glosses: To put a vehicle in neutral gear, to put it out of gear.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish بوشه آلمق (boşa almaḳ, “to suspend in the air”), equivalent to compound of boş (“empty, hollow, vanity, futility, idleness”) + -a (dative suffix) + almak (“to take, to receive”), literally “to take into empty, idleness”.
